subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... ... and the following two are very different .... public class Test { private ExpensiveResource bigObject; public Test() { bigObject =
messageBody:
> Mmmh, let me make my point clearer then.
>
> The following four classes:
>
> ======
> public class Test {
> private String m_name = "Cedric";
> ======
> public class Test {
> private String m_name;
> public Test() {
> m_name = "Cedric";
> }
> =====
> public class Test {
> private String m_name;
> public void setUp() {
> m_name = "Cedric";
> }
> =====
> public class Test {
> private String m_name;
> public test1() {
> m_name = "Cedric";
> }
> ====
>
> are *all* running identically with JUnit: the field "m_name" will receive
> the value "Cedric" before the invocation of each test method.
>

... and the following two are very different ....

public class Test {
private ExpensiveResource bigObject;

public Test() {
bigObject = ExpensiveResource.fragileInit();
}

====

public class Test {
private ExpensiveResource bigObject;

protected void setUp() throws ItFailedException {
bigObject = ExpensiveResource.fragileInit();
}



... and these two will have different behavior ....

public class Test {
private GlobalResource resource;

public Test() {
resource = GlobalResource.init();
}

====

public class Test {
private GlobalResource resource;

protected void setUp() {
resource = GlobalResource.init();
}


Kevin
